title: Watch: Man Asks Vet To Perform Gender Transition Surgery On His Tutu-Clad Dog In Telling Skit
description:
A man decided to take a stand against child sex change operations by filming what happened when he tried to take his dog in for one. Spoiler: they refused him services. Since dogs can't consent and all that. Plus, it's ridiculous.

The man brought his male French bulldog, donning a pink tutu, to a vet. He explains to the workers that while his dog is in fact a male, every time he puts a tutu in front of the dog, the dog immediately puts it on. And therefore, the dog is actually a female and requires a gender transition operation.

"We want to do a gender transition to make him female. But we don't want to neuter him."

\u201cViral video of man taking dog for "gender transition" proves how disgusting and wrong child sex changes are\n\nhttps://t.co/fnnqZ9dbEx\u201d
— The Post Millennial (@The Post Millennial) 1681500311

The male worker says they don't offer sex change operations at the clinic, and told them to "go somewhere with a specialist". The female worker explains the vet is not a "behavioral health clinic". The man responds, "I wouldn’t call that behavioral. You’re saying gender identity is behavioral?” And the woman immediately backpedals.

The dog and owner are then asked to leave, and he says he will report the incident "to the LGBTQ+ minus 2 Association of America."

While children are clearly not equal to dogs (no matter how much those "dog moms" with strollers insist), this is still a decent analogy. Children obviously have infinitely more reason than animals. But they cannot consent to things like permanent sex-change operations since their brains are not yet fully formed, and they don't have a clear understanding of the world. Because they're children.

Children believe in a jolly old man who comes down their chimney to leave presents and a giant bunny that leaves them eggs full of candy. They don't exactly have the logic stuff down pat yet, nor should they. But it's the responsibility of adults to help shape their view of the world, foster logic and reason, and protect them from lies - like those of the trans cult. As opposed to taking everything the child says as absolute truth.

>

<

Lily is a Zoomer college dropout who somehow landed a writing gig here at LwC.com. In her spare time, she enjoys going for runs, touching grass, and occasionally tweeting tweets for fellow tweeters.

title: Watch: Granny's brutal (yet hilarious) critique of granddaughter's tattoo goes viral
description:
Blunt grandparents are gifts to us all and often a much-needed check on our egos. Just like this British Gran who had some choice words for her granddaughter's new butterfly tattoo. Specifically, "sh*t".

The gal shows off her fresh ink in the video, a butterfly with one of its wings made up of flowers. If any of you ladies are Pinterest fiends like I am, you've likely seen this exact design somewhere on your feed. The girl's older sister, who's filming the interaction, asks their grandma what she thinks of Izzy's tattoo. To which she replies, "sh*t" and calls it "horrible".

Izzy was not happy.

\u201cShe did not hold back!\ud83d\ude2c\nhttps://t.co/bS5wQRaRsm\u201d
— Mirror Weird News (@Mirror Weird News) 1681416660

Izzy asked, "Do you know what else is horrible? I'm not going to say because I don't want to hurt your feelings like you just hurt mine." Grandma then tried to explain why she thought the new ink is the equivalent of feces, saying it's "not finished off properly" because "it's only got two wings and a body." Izzy protested, but her Gran was referring to the flowers that replace the butterfly's other two wings: "You could have them over that flower, it's stupid."

The sister then turned the camera to ask their mother what she thought, but Grandma was not finished yet, adding, "It'll be an old moth soon anyway."

I can see how, if I were in the daughter's position, I may be a tad irritated and self-conscious of the new insect tattooed on my body. But you have to admit, this Grandma is pretty rad. The sister filming the interaction said her response was "no surprise" and "she has no filter and says everything she thinks with no hesitation." Which I find quite refreshing. But Izzy clearly did not.

>

<

Lily is a Zoomer college dropout who somehow landed a writing gig here at LwC.com. In her spare time, she enjoys going for runs, touching grass, and occasionally tweeting tweets for fellow tweeters.

title: Watch: Protesters rush the stage of a Ron DeSantis speech, but he shuts them down with an all-time one-liner
description:
Ron DeSantis was the featured guest at the New Hampshire GOP annual Amos Tuck dinner. It was a record-breaking event as DeSantis brought in more money than any other speaker before him. Though the speech got a little spicy when two women representing "Jews Against DeSantis" rushed the stage. DeSantis wasn't bothered.

Side note: after New Hampshire, DeSantis visits South Carolina later this month. He was in Iowa last month.

#BREAKING: Protestors storm an unphased Gov. Ron DeSantis at New Hampshire event

They chanted "Jews against DeSantis!"

DeSantis: "Why you'd want to pay the ticket to get in just to do that, I don't know!" pic.twitter.com/zwNnlz7590
— Florida’s Voice (@FLVoiceNews) April 14, 2023

This I thought was an all-time line.

Why you'd want to pay the ticket to get in just to do that, I don't know!

They were hecklers heckling a GOP governor at a GOP fundraiser. I can only assume they were far-left activists because only far left-activists would do such a thing. George Soros must have bought their tickets for them.

But "Jews Against DeSantis..." in New Hampshire? Is there a growing Jewish population in the live-free-or-die state that has stayed off the radar all these years? I could understand if they were "Maple Syrup Producers Against DeSantis" or "Foliage Aficionados Against DeSantis.'

Different strokes, I guess.

>

<

Brodigan is Grand Poobah of this here website and when he isn't writing words about things enjoys day drinking, pro-wrestling, and country music. You can find him on the Twitter too.

title: Watch: James O'Keefe confronts Dylan Mulvaney and Dylan couldn't get away from him fast enough
description:
You had to know this was coming. Our favorite rouser of rabble James O'Keefe tracking down TikTok ingénue Dylan Mulvaney. Dylan, as you know, caused a BREWhaha (folks, these are the jokes) this month announcing a brand ambassadorship with Bud Light. Turns out, Bud Light drinkers? Not fans.

Let's see what James and Dylan have to say.

JUST NOW AT FOUR SEASONS IN LA.: James O’Keefe Questions @budlight’s Dylan Mulvaney on OMG Jailhouse footage showing women inmates testifying on being housed with male rapists claiming to be transgender.

Subscribe at https://t.co/QeHZGnqqBF @OKeefeMedia #MillionDollarBaby pic.twitter.com/25fGkr8AFg
— James O'Keefe (@JamesOKeefeIII) April 14, 2023

I'll be honest, I don't love it. It's like the paparazzi stuff the Daily Mail and the New York Post are doing, which is just weird. I would have gone in a different direction with this video.

Nothing but respect for O'Keefe. He's got his new media company OMG Media, and they released a shocking video about men who claim to be women in a women's prison. Where the female inmates are being raped by the men claiming to be men.

Was asking Dylan about footage we released yesterday from the Washington Corrections Center for Women s=46
pic.twitter.com/l1QbZc4Snv
— James O'Keefe (@JamesOKeefeIII) April 14, 2023

But you can't just go assuming that because Dylan is trans Dylan would have an opinion about trans prison rape. That's not inclusion. That's not equity. If you are going to corner Dylan, you have to ask Dylan about things Dylancentric. Like out of all the women he could decide to be, why did she choose a vapid, basic, insulting parody of a woman? The kind who would be the alpha in the local mommy Facebook group if biologically able to be a mommy. One who only cares about clothes, adultery, and tampons they have no use for.

Amen😂 pic.twitter.com/wdYoYJPslt
— CCP IS ASSHOE (@CCPISASSH0E) April 15, 2023

If anything, O'Keefe lucked out. Being a natural performer, Dylan knew how to act weak and helpless. Had Dylan been born a girl, they would have the ability to cry on demand. Men who were born men only cry when their dad or dog dies, when their favorite team wins the Super Bowl (Go Bills), or at the end of Warrior where Brendan Conlon says "I'm sorry Tommy."

Had Dylan been able to fake a few tears, O'Keefe would have look like a big meanie and that would have been the story. That, and clickbait articles cherry-picking a handful of "conservatives" criticizing James, complaining we are spending so much bandwidth on Dylan, and derpity derpy derp derp.

P.S. The women's prison rape story is messed up. Cheers to OMG Media for exposing it.

>

<

Brodigan is Grand Poobah of this here website and when he isn't writing words about things enjoys day drinking, pro-wrestling, and country music. You can find him on the Twitter too.

title: Watch: Another unruly customer learns the hard way Waffle House employees are trained to throw down
description:
As a northerner, everything I know about Waffle House I know from the viral videos. The drunken Luke Combs sing-a-longs at 3 am look like fun. Our version of the Waffle House is diners. Every town has them. They never close. You can stumble in after the bar for a plate of cheese fries and a pot of coffee. Diners are the spot up north.

But it rarely ever pops off like this.

Waffle House pic.twitter.com/zDLPdpoabA
— Clown World ™ 🤡 (@ClownWorld_) April 14, 2023

I actually did some research to see when this took place. You never know with videos going viral on the bird app, and it's not like I haven't been fooled before. Brawls between Waffle House employees and customers. Then there's this guy.

I wonder if part of your Waffle House training, besides how to make waffles and a decent pot of coffee, includes a minimum of fifty hours at the local boxing club. Or if the pugilistic skills are more on-the-job training. Just saying, the employee looks like he's been in a few scraps before.

However, the real hero in this video? My man recording the brawl who had the wherewithal to have Gonna Fly Now from Rocky playing in the background. That's a guy who understands the content! Plus, casually dropping "can I get a waffle" as the brawl breaks out, he understands the value of branding with a good tagline. For that alone, I give this video a 10/10.

>

<

Brodigan is Grand Poobah of this here website and when he isn't writing words about things enjoys day drinking, pro-wrestling, and country music. You can find him on the Twitter too.
